citations.narrative:
* The cage card information attached to multiple enclosures containing 105 (unweaned) puppies was incomplete. The
identification, breed and sex of the puppies were missing. Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each
puppy identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the ability to trace all puppies. The licensee must maintain
complete and accurate records of all puppies at their facility. Correct by 4/14/23.

* There is a mixture of dirt accumulating on the top of an estimated 20 fiberglass calf hutch enclosures. Fifty dogs are in
contact with the affected surfaces located in outdoor housing. The affected area covers the entire top of the calf hutch.
Cleaning of surfaces is necessary to prevent an accumulation of excreta and other disease hazards. This indicates an
unsanitary living condition exists that could lead to potential disease or health risks. Surfaces which are not cleaned and
sanitized properly increase the risk of disease hazards for the dogs. Cleanliness is important to the health and well-being
of the animals. All surfaces of housing facilities must be cleaned and sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally
accepted husbandry standards and practices. The applicant must ensure that hard surfaces with which the dogs come in
contact must be spot cleaned daily and sanitized in accordance with 3.11 (B) of this sub part to prevent accumulation of
excreta and reduce disease hazards. Correct by 3/16/23.

* The licensee could not locate the last recorded date for annual heartworm, and fecal float testing for 236 adult dogs.
Annual heartworm and fecal float testing are important for the health of the animals. Heartworm and fecal float testing is
done to ensure that there are no active internal parasites. The licensee must ensure that all dogs are receiving
vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling
and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 4/14/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
*      The cage card information attached to multiple enclosures containing 105 (unweaned) puppies was incomplete.  The 
identification, breed and sex of the puppies were missing.  Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each 
puppy identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the ability to trace all puppies.  The licensee must maintain 
complete and accurate records of all puppies at their facility. Correct by 4/14/23. 
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
*  There is a mixture of dirt accumulating on the top of an estimated 20 fiberglass calf hutch enclosures.  Fifty dogs are in 
contact with the affected surfaces located in outdoor housing. The affected area covers the entire top of the calf hutch.  
Cleaning of surfaces is necessary to prevent an accumulation of excreta and other disease hazards.  This indicates an 
unsanitary living condition exists that could lead to potential disease or health risks.  Surfaces which are not cleaned and 
sanitized properly increase the risk of disease hazards for the dogs. Cleanliness is important to the health and well-being 
of the animals. All surfaces of housing facilities must be cleaned and sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally 
accepted husbandry standards and practices.   The applicant must ensure that hard surfaces with which the dogs come in 
contact must be spot cleaned daily and sanitized in accordance with 3.11 (B) of this sub part to prevent accumulation of 
excreta and reduce disease hazards.  Correct by 3/16/23.

3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
*   The licensee could not locate the last recorded date for annual heartworm, and fecal float testing for 236 adult dogs.  
Annual heartworm and fecal float testing are important for the health of the animals.  Heartworm and fecal float testing is 
done to ensure that there are no active internal parasites.   The licensee must ensure that all dogs are receiving 
vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling 
and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian.  Correct by 4/14/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
